IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The American Civil Liberties Union of Northern California (ACLU NC UNION) DEFENDS AND ADVANCES THE PRINCIPLES OF FREEDOM, EQUALITY AND JUSTICE CONTAINED IN THE UNITED STATES CONSTITUTION. IT DOES SO THROUGH A RANGE OF LEGISLATIVE AND COMMUNITY ACTION AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE ACLU OF NORTHERN CALIFORNIA, INC. (ACLU NC UNION) DEFENDS AND ADVANCES THEPRINCIPLES OF FREEDOM, EQUALITY AND JUSTICE CONTAINED IN THE UNITED STATESCONSTITUTION FOR ALL. IT DOES SO THROUGH A RANGE OF LEGISLATIVE AND COMMUNITY ACTIONAND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS.The American Civil Liberties Union of Northern California (ACLU NC Union) is a California nonprofit mutual benefit corporation that is described in Section 501(c)(4). ACLU NC Union serves as the designator with the power to appoint the members of the Board of Directors of The American Civil Liberties Union Foundation of Northern California (ACLU NC Foundation), a California nonprofit public benefit corporation described in Section 501(c)(3). ACLU NC Union is affiliated with the American Civil Liberties Union, Inc. (ACLU National), a District of Columbia not-for-profit corporation described in Section 501(c)(4).To reduce costs and maximize efficiency, the ACLU NC Union and the ACLU NC Foundation share certain resources pursuant to
IRS990.Desc: Community and Civic Engagement - The ACLU NC UNION maintains a robust program of community and civic engagement to encourage and support regular Californians to participate in activities to defend and advance civil liberties. These programs include trainings, workshops and conferences. The ACLU NC UNION also maintains and supports a network of local chapters throughout Northern California, that are active in community education and advocacy projects.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Center for Advocacy and Policy - The ACLU NC UNION maintains an active presence at the California state capitol through the ACLU of California Center for Advocacy and Policy (CAP). This program is conducted in collaboration with the American Civil Liberties Union of Southern California and the American Civil Liberties Union of San Diego & Imperial Counties, Inc. and is run by the ACLU NC Union. The CAP office reviews hundreds of bills each year to ensure that they do not harm civil liberties and civil rights. CAP staff also provide analysis, testimony and expert information to policymakers including legislators and state agency officials. This year, CAP actively supported a number of bills to advance civil liberties and civil rights in key issues, including immigrants rights, bail reform, privacy, educational equity, due process, and a number of other issues.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: CRIMINAL JUSTICE - The ACLU NC UNION maintains a significant focus on the issues of due process and equal protection in every stage of the criminal justice system, from policing, to pretrial detention to prosecutor charging decisions. The ACLU NC UNION led significant programs to educate the public and policy makers on legislation related to transparency of officer misconduct records as well as for bail reform. It also led a project to educate the public about the important role of prosecutors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The ACLU NC UNION believes that it has appropriate support for any tax positions taken, and as such, does not have any uncertain tax positions that are material to the financial statements.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 4: Description of Significant Changes to Organizational Documents
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Since its prior Form 990 was filed on February 13, 2018, the ACLU NC Union adopted Amended and Restated Bylaws on September 15, 2018.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 6: Explanation of Classes of Members or Shareholder
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Under the terms of both its previous Bylaws that were in effect for the fiscal year reported on in these 990s, and under its new Bylaws, the ACLU NC Union has one class of Members.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 7a: How Members or Shareholders Elect Governing Body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Under the terms of its new Bylaws, the Members of the ACLU NC Union elect all of its directors. Members vote from among nominees presented by the Board of Directors or nominated directly by Members. The Board-nominated directors are elected according to the following process: the Board adopts criteria that guides the work of a nominating committee, which proposes a slate of qualified candidates for the Board to submit to the Members. The bylaws that were in effect during the fiscal year reported on in this Form 990 also had some members of the board of directors who were designated by chapters.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 7b: Describe Decisions of Governing Body Approval by Members or Shareholders
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: As required by the California Corporations Code, a few governing decisions (such as approval of amendments to the Bylaws which substantially effect the rights of Members) are reserved to Members under the Bylaws of the ACLU NC Union.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 is provided to all members of the finance committee, audit and compliance committee and Board for review prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Each Board member is required to complete a Conflict of Interest Form annually. The Board Chair then reviews each conflict of interest form for any potential issues.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The ACLU NC UNION Board of Directors takes the following steps regarding compensation: (a) it sets the salary and bonus for the Executive Director each year based on a review process, consultation to salary survey data and sometimes after consulting with independent experts, (b) it relies on the work of a compensation committee, (c) the salaries of the Executive Director and all other employees are subject to the term of the budget set each year by the ACLU NC UNION Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Financial Statements are posted to ACLU NC Union website and are available upon request.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, LINE 1A - DELEGATION OF AUTHORITY TO EXECUTIVE COM
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Directors of the ACLU NC Union has an executive committee composed entirely of members of the Board of Directors (Executive Committee). The Executive Committee has the authority to act on behalf of the Board of Directors of the ACLU NC Union except for certain actions which are reserved to the Board of Directors in Article VII, Section 1 of the Bylaws of the ACLU NC Union.
